name: thriftSink
description: This sink forms one half of Flumeâ€™s tiered collection support. Flume events sent to this sink are turned into Thrift events and sent to the configured hostname / port pair. The events are taken from the configured Channel in batches of the configured batch size. Required properties are in bold.

hostname.name: hostname
hostname.description: The hostname or IP address to bind to.

batchSize.name: batch-size
batchSize.description: The number of event to batch together for send.

connectTimeout.name: connect-timeout
connectTimeout.description: Amount of time (ms) to allow for the first (handshake) request.

requestTimeout.name: request-timeout
requestTimeout.description: Amount of time (ms) to allow for requests after the first.

connectResetInterval.name: connect-reset-interval
connectResetInterval.description: Amount of time (s) before the connection to the next hop is reset. This will force the Thrift Sink to reconnect to the next hop. This will allow the sink to connect to hosts behind a hardware load-balancer when news hosts are added without having to restart the agent.
